questions.uddipok: Write a letter to the Traffic Division of Dhaka Metropolitan Police to take imperative steps to check the unendurable noise in the streets of the city.

sub_questions.explanation:
07 May 2024
Additional Commissioner
The Traffic Division, Dhaka Metropolitan Police
Dhaka
Subject: Application for taking measures against the unendurable noise in the streets of the city.
Sir, I would like to draw your attention to the fact that the noise in the streets of our city is getting unendurable day by day. Dhaka is a densely populated city for which its streets tend to get crowded as well. But the traffic noise is getting out of control and affecting our quality of life. The sound of the engines and blaring of the horns can be heard without a rest. It interferes with our concentration, distupts sleep and leads to stress related issues. In the long run, continuous exposure to loud noises can also cause severe hearing loss. I, therefore, hope that you would kindly consider taking imperative steps to check unendurable noise in the streets of the city and oblige us thereby.
Yours faithfully,
Abdul Fahad
Manda Union, Dhaka

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph about 'Amor Ekushey Boi Mela' within 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Ekushey Book Fair
Ekushey book fair, officially known as "Amar Ekushey Boi Mela," is a symbol of the struggle that brought us the freedom to speak our language. It commemorates the martyrs of the Language Movement of 1952. The fair is generally held on the premises of the Bangla Academy throughout the month of February every year. At the book fair, there are hundreds of bookstalls selling different types of books, arranged by various famous publishers of our country. A few bookstalls are also organised by some leading cultural organisations of the country. All kinds of books, from fiction, drama, poetry and novel to biography, translation, children's literature, story books, etc. can be found at the fair. Besides the book stalls, there are information counters, food stalls and a kids' zone where famous puppet characters can be seen performing. Since it is a well-known fair, there is always a huge rush of people equivalent throughout the day. Then it gets more crowded during the weekend. Qutside the Bangla Academy premises, there are more stalls displaying attractive handicrafts made of cane and clay. Authors of the books visit the book fair as well and meet with the readers. Sometimes people also get their books signed by their favorite authors. Ekushey book fair is a joyous occasion where people come to celebrate the precious language, literature and culture of our country.

questions.uddipok: Write a pragraph in about 200 words on "Unemployment in Bangladesh" mentioning its causes and effects.

sub_questions.explanation:
Causes and Effects of Unemployment in Bangladesh
Unemployment refers to the state of a person, capable of working, unable to find a paid job. In Bangladesh, unemployment still remains as one of the significant challenges. In order to address this issue hindering economic growth, the causes of unemployment need to be explored first. Rapid population growth is a major factor behind the unemployment rate. In comparison to the population, there are not enough job opportunities in the market. So, when a fresh graduate or anyone from the working-age enters the job market, the competition is quite fierce for a single seat. On the other hand, due to the digitalization of the country, laborers are being replaced with machines in the work field. Although automation helps businesses by improving its productivity and accuracy, it leaves a gap in the job market by reducing job opportunities. Lack of proper training and workoriented education are some of the other contributing factors regarding unemployment. The effect of unemployment falls directly on the economy of the country. Without a source of an income, unemployed people fail to provide themselves and their families with basic necessities. As a result, their standard of living meets no improvement. The pressure of finding a job and affording expenses collectively may cause extreme mental health issues for the people involved. It is a serious issue that the government cannot fix alone; we should all come forward to build a better nation by reducing unemployment in the country.
